story:
Short Summary

We A.Masow Architects created the design of the house which we believe will change the future! The peculiarity of it is that it is not dependent on the urban communications, does not require any connection, it is independent.  it is able to itself provide electricity, heat, water.

Two years ago we created it, but in the meantime we have received many offers to make a documentary film.

Media about it:
Over 250 media representatives: newspapers, magazines, web portals and TV channels including National Geographic, Discovery and Animal Planet contacted us to learn more about it and shared the idea of an environment friendly house. 

And then we understood that we need to bring this eco-house project to life, because it is the future, which doesn't require anything for living there.

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to help create a project that will change the future of all the buildings.

The Impact

We want everyone to be able to visit this house, drink coffee, read the book,  to have dinner there etc. we want to make everyone understand that we shouldn't destroy the half of hectare of forest to build a small house for one family. We want to show that 35 sq meters of land are sufficient for one family, without any harm to the nature

Risks & Challenges

The government has allowed us to carry out this project next to the spa at the foot of the mountains.

Our team solved all the problems that may arise during the construction and after.

Other Ways You Can Help

You will help to us if you will visit this house!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
We A.Masow Architects created the design of the house which we believe will change the future! The peculiarity of it is that it is not dependent on the urban communications, does not require any connection, it is independent.  it is able to itself provide electricity, heat, water.
Two years ago we created it, but in the meantime we have received many offers to make a documentary film.
Media about it:Over 250 media representatives: newspapers, magazines, web portals and TV channels including National Geographic, Discovery and Animal Planet contacted us to learn more about it and shared the idea of an environment friendly house. 
And then we understood that we need to bring this eco-house project to life, because it is the future, which doesn't require anything for living there.   What We Need & What You Get We need you to help create a project that will change the future of all the buildings.
    The Impact We want everyone to be able to visit this house, drink coffee, read the book,  to have dinner there etc. we want to make everyone understand that we shouldn't destroy the half of hectare of forest to build a small house for one family. We want to show that 35 sq meters of land are sufficient for one family, without any harm to the nature
  Risks & Challenges 
The government has allowed us to carry out this project next to the spa at the foot of the mountains.
Our team solved all the problems that may arise during the construction and after.
    Other Ways You Can Help You will help to us if you will visit this house!

story:
Hi my name is Tony

Myself and my hardworking team have been servicing the local area from Byron Bay to Lismore for almost a decade. 

We not only provide the products essential to maintaining a pool, but also have a great time of guys who service pools in these shires regularly.

Sadly, our Lismore shop was affected by the floodwaters created by cyclone Debbie.  The flood water rose to 1 meter above our stores roof!

Due to difficulties in getting retail insurance in Lismore which is a well known flood plain, we are now struggling to get our Lismore shop back on its feet.  

It is important to us to not only be able to get back to servicing the local community quickly, but we also want to keep the wonderful knowledgeable staff that we have employed in our Lismore store.

Any funds generated will go directly into repairing the stores infrastructure, as the roof, walls, fixtures and fittings were very badly damaged by the floodwaters.  We also lost most of the stock.  

Our goal is to raise 20,000 or as near as possible as we can.  Any amount raised will assist on helping us recover.

We appreciate any help raising this money, or please get the word out about our plight! 

Kindest regards

Tony

story:
KILLER WHALE: A New Era in Bathroom Disinfection

Strange name right? Killer Whale? But here is the logic behind the name: Our device operates in a wet environment, and it kills. It kills the things that cause infections in your bathroom.


 

Hello!

My name is Benjamin Sonovani.
Like many of you, my family and I are in quarantine during this Corona virus pandemic. We can't go out. It's impossible to know who is infected and who could possibly transmit this disease to other people. It is more important than ever to be diligent about disinfecting our homes.                                                              
 

 

 History of KILLER WHALE:

A good friend of mine died tragically as a result of an infection.
His death hit me hard.
He is the one who inspired me to create the Killer Whale. My friend was a doctor, full of medical knowledge, and yet he still died because of an infection. Two years ago, grief-stricken, I decided to do something to prevent the next infection. Together with my partners, we founded Killer Whale, the toilet-cleaning device to support the disabled, the elderly, children and other people who have difficulties keeping their toilet as clean as it should be.

 

                                                         


Most of our self-invested money was spent on seeking a patent and building an effective prototype. Killer Whale requires no installation, no messing around and can help save people like my friend.
 I’m proud to say that Killer Whale was patented in December 2019.


 

 

How Killer Whale Works:

Killer Whale is an autonomous device that operates 24/7.

When idle, the system is turned off. When in use, a full disinfection of the toilet bowl and seat will be performed after each use.                  
 


The special cleansing formula is designed to eradicate most germs that thrive within the toilet compartment. Much like a computer printer, Killer Whale uses cleaning fluid cartridges. You’ll be asked to routinely replace the cartridges, usually once in a month, depending on the size of your family and the frequency of use of the toilet. The disinfection process of Killer Whale starts from the exterior of the toilet, including droplets in the air. With 99% of bacteria, viruses and germs killed, you'll know for sure that the health of your family is secure.

Killer Whale sprays the toilet bowl with disinfection liquid and cleans the bowl, killing germs after you finish your business and before the next person steps in.
This small, efficient device cleans and disinfects the toilet surface and its seat. Killer Whale lets you know when it's done by changing the color of the water inside the bowl.



  • So, we have a working prototype.
    A product that millions of people all over the globe who are in quarantine today could benefit from using, but we have no money to get it out onto the market.
    The current outbreak of coronavirus emphasizes the battle mankind is facing in our pursuit of a healthy life and environment. Making sure that we live in neat and clean surroundings is necessary.Can you help us?


Features of Killer Whale:

  • The cartridge requires a replacement once a month on average.
     
  • The cartridge can be purchased through our website. We will do everything in our power to ship anywhere in the world. Cartridges for public places like your office will contain extra amounts of cleaning fluids to prevent the need for frequent replacement.
     
  • Killer Whale is designed to work only when the user left the room, and is perfectly safe for all ages.
     
  • The Killer Whale device does not require any installation and no electricity or water connection is needed.
    Just plugin on top of the bowl and the system will run!
     
  • The batteries are rechargeable and will last for six months on average. The cleansing formula is evaporates from the seat very quickly and is completely safe for humans.

Your Donation: All donations will be used to mass manufacture the Killer Whale units. We will strive to the first large batch of units in the next two to three months. Check out our perks section for all the exciting perks we're offering in exchange for your financial contribution to this project.

 

 

Risk Management

Our team is composed of industry experts with international backgrounds and a variety of refined skills.

On our team we have: chemists, mechanical and electronic engineers,
and software developers.

This minimizes any risk or problems in delivering the ready devices at the set time.

 

Why we need you

We had the privilege to  successfully invent an awesome outstanding device but without your help, we won’t be able to move to mass production. The world number one toilet infection defense Device is now around the corner - you can make it come true. Your backup will also enable us to add some specifications that have never been seen in any other disinfectant. We also need you to help to prevent the current pandemic. The product can save lives, help us achieve this goal. 

 

Help out by Sharing

 

 

 

One more favor? Could you please share this campaign with your friends and family on social media? Every share, like, and comment gets is that much closer to our goal. Thank you so much!

story:
The Trance Copper Sphere

"Once again Rudy has designed a simply elegant piece of artwork that also feeds the spirit, mind, and body."  -- Anna K.

"What a beautiful addition to my Forge Solid Cubes. Can't wait to see the next thing you come up with." -- Susan P.

"Now I'll have a cool sphere next to my Esington glass!" -- Jason A.

Why do I need a trance sphere?

A gold pen, a solid watch, Italian leather shoes.  You surround yourself with things that make your environment more beautiful, more connected, more you. The trance sphere is a striking, solid piece of brilliant copper - handcrafted precision.  

Take a look at your desk.  What's on it?  What does it say about you?

What’s so special about copper?

  • It’s Oligodynamic, which means it naturally kills germs on contact. 
  • We each have about 2mg of copper in our body, without which we could not survive.
  • It’s dense - between lead and steel in density 
  • Along with gold, the only non-greyish pure metal 
  • Takes on its own unique hue over time and can be “reset” to brilliancy with baking soda and water (or salt and vinegar).

Copper compounds have been used in medicine to treat many ailments, including arthritis

 About the Oligodynamic Effect

Pure copper prevents growth and even kills bacteria, molds, spores, fungi, viruses and other organisms.  The exact cause is unknown, but it's likely that the ions denature the protein of the cells by binding to reactive groups (precipitating and inactivating them).  Copper has the strongest known effect of pure metals.  

One study showed that a copper vessel filled with E. Coli and Salmonella killed the bacteria in less than half the time vs. silver and brass.  Many hospitals are now using pure copper on everything from hospital beds to doorknobs in order to fight "superbugs".

How is it made?

Updated!  We're now using a precision machining process to get a perfect finish.  A large cylinder of copper is put onto a metal lathe and carefully worked using a CNC.  This results in the most perfect finish you can imagine.  Here is a video of the process:

This results in a perfect sphere, every time

Specs

Specs for 1 pound sphere:

  • Finish: polished
  • 454 grams (minimum)
  • 1.81 inches (4.60 cm) diameter 
  • Comes with ring base (as pictured)

Specs for 1 kilogram sphere:

  • Finish: polished
  • 1000 grams (minimum) 
  • 2.35 inches (5.98 cm) diameter 
  • Comes with ring base (as pictured)

Specs for MEGA sphere:

  • Finish: polished
  • 2400 grams (5.2 pounds)
  • 3.1 inches (8.00 cm) diameter
  • Comes with ring base (as pictured)

Titanium unlocked!  

Perfect Titanium spheres now unlocked!

  • 1.81 inches (4.60 cm) or 2.35 inches (5.98 cm) diameter
  • Sizes match copper sphere sizes
  • 99%+ pure Titanium
  • Comes with ring base (as pictured) 
  • Finish: polished

Who is Trance Metals?

Hi, I’m Rudy Marsh! In 2015, I partnered with Nir Leibovich to bring you the Esington Glass. We raised over $196k on Kickstarter and brought the Esington Glass to life with your help!

Next, I partnered with Jaime Raijman at Forge Solid to bring you the Forge Solid cube, raising over $487k on Kickstarter. (Eventually we bought Forge Solid from Jaime!)

Why I made a copper sphere

Many years ago, my father melted down a ½ pound spool of leftover copper wire. For no particular reason other than it seemed like a really cool thing to do. I remember thinking how attractive the resulting ball of copper was. I was drawn to it. It was particularly satisfying to roll it around on my hands. Maybe I had a copper deficiency and my body was trying to absorb it? I don’t know, but it seemed like everyone enjoyed holding it. At the time, I knew nothing about the oligodynamic effect (germ killing) or health benefits of copper. I just knew I loved that blob of solid copper.

After my mother passed away, I remembered that chunk of copper when reminiscing over our happy days together. I really wanted to buy a large piece of copper just to have for myself. I couldn’t find a large, solid piece of copper anywhere, so I had one made.

When the prototype was shipped to my house, my 3 year old son was immediately drawn to it. He really didn’t want to stop handling it. Now it’s on my desk at work along with my Esington Glass and Forge Solid cube. It gets the most attention of the three by far.

What is it about copper? Maybe it’s the distinct color? Maybe we have some other connection to it? I’m not sure, I just know it’s the thing people want to hold and talk about the most.

What people are saying

"Hi there, just wanted to let you know I was a huge fan and backer of the tungsten project, and found this awesome as well. So backing this was a no brainer." -- Mohamad S.

"I just backed your latest KS campaign. I love your stuff and have two cubes and one hourglass already in my home. Can't wait to see this 1kilo sphere... I'm sure your campaign will be another huge success." -- Dan D.

"Hello! I was one of your esington backers, I just backed this project too...My father is a huge fan of copper so I figured This would be a wonderful gift to him. Thank you!" -- Jennifer L.

"Hey Rudy! I backed Esington (actually a Day 1 backer on that, too, I'm proud to say!!) and I just backed Trance...I love your products! Keep up the good work!" -- Tania D. 

"I backed the tungsten KS project and love it. My wife is copper crazy and will think this is perfect. I hope you are able to get a good polish. Great job on the super speedy funding!!!!!"  -- Mike E.

"Congrats on getting funded so quickly. It's very impressive but not surprising! A true statement to the quality of your previous products and how much people liked them. I already got my own pledge and 3 more friends are onboard. Congrats again." -- Kosta Z.

"Hi Rudy, I'm a backer of the Forge Kilo (which I loved by the way) and pledged for the Trance Copper Sphere as an early-bird backer." -- Brian H.

"Looks so cool. All Backed!  Thanks and look forward to holding this thing..." -- Darrel R.

"Stunning! I did back Esington and am looking forward to adding the Copper sphere to my collection. Best wishes" -- Lee A.

"I think this project just might be more interesting than the Forge Solid! I backed that project for two cubes and this sphere will be a nice addition to my collection." Robert S.

"Hi Rudy, Count me in of the Trance Copper Sphere -- looks very cool and will be a nice addition next to my Esington glass! Onward!" -- Steve P.

"Hello! I was a backer of the [tungsten] cube project! I actually regret not getting a larger size of the cube, but now i can make up for it in copper! The cube was definitely helpful and calming just to have on my desk, so I cant wait to see the sphere!" Florence W.

"Excited for your new project! Everyone who sees the cubes from the Forge Solid project loves it. Woohoo!" -- Butch W.

"Hi, I am an [Esington] backer and just backed your Copper Spere at the 2x 1kg level. Looking forward to this - love my timers!" -- Monika R.

"Hi - I just backed the Trance Copper Sphere...and was a backer of the Forge Solid as well. Thank you for another cool project!" -- John B.

"Hi! As a backer for your Esington glass project, I got your email today about this project and immediately had to back it. The images of this copper ball look amazing and I can't wait to see this project fulfilled!" -- Nicole T.

"G'day. I love my Tungsten cube and would love to get a copper sphere to put next to it. These are such awesome ideas. Thank you for doing them" -- Matthew I.

"Hi Rudy,...I just pledged the 1 lb. copper sphere in matte. I love my Esington glass, every one who comes over to my home, if they come in my living room they are drawn to it to turn it up side down" -- Nate K.

"I backed the cubes and use them at work regularly. I teach at the military EOD (bomb squad) school in the nuclear division. The density of the kilo helps me show the how small 2 lbs of fissile material can be when talking about criticality incidents. I have backed this at the kilo size as well and it looks awesome." -- James H.

Please pledge now and help us bring the Trance Copper Sphere to life! 

Thank you,

Rudy Marsh

Risks and challenges

The Esington Glass and Forge Solid cube projects were incredibly educational. With over 6000 backers all over the world between them, manufacturing and logistics were incredibly complex for someone with no previous experience.

After several trips to manufacturers in Asia, switching shipping companies, sourcing companies and export agents, I feel like we are in a much better place than we were before our unexpected success on Kickstarter. I’m also proud to be one of the few small companies to have 100% fulfillment on our large campaigns.

There are always risks involved, but the biggest one is always the timeline. We were late shipping the bulk of both projects (though we did manage to get many of our early birds on time). We’ve given ourselves an extra month with this timeline and feel very confident we can deliver on time. If we do run into manufacturing, logistics or shipping issues, we’ll always keep you updated. We promise to deliver 100%, just as we have on every other project.

With over 6000 backers all over the world between them, manufacturing and logistics were incredibly complex for someone with no previous experience.After several trips to manufacturers in Asia, switching shipping companies, sourcing companies and export agents, I feel like we are in a much better place than we were before our unexpected success on Kickstarter. I’m also proud to be one of the few small companies to have 100% fulfillment on our large campaigns.There are always risks involved, but the biggest one is always the timeline. We were late shipping the bulk of both projects (though we did manage to get many of our early birds on time). We’ve given ourselves an extra month with this timeline and feel very confident we can deliver on time. If we do run into manufacturing, logistics or shipping issues, we’ll always keep you updated. We promise to deliver 100%, just as we have on every other project.

story:
The Story

What would you do if you lost everything only weeks before a new baby? Well that's exactly what happened to my best friend, Shaun Byrd. On Tuesday December 13th, 2011, Shaun's family lost everything from smoke damage when their apartment building had a huge fire right down the hall. All this happening only weeks before Christmas and even worse, Alyssa (his wife) is 9 months pregnant and due any day. It couldn't have happened at a worse time. He doesn't know what to do and that's why I'm starting this to help him and his family recover before the new baby is welcomed to the world.


What We Need

We are only asking for $3,000 to help him cover the moving costs (apartment costs, etc) and get some basic things for the new apartment like a bed and crib for the new baby on the way. He could use more than $3,000 to really get back on his feet, but we set the goal for the bare minimum of what's needed. Any extra funds will go towards replacing things like a couch, clothes and toys for the kids. We appreciate all the help!

All moneys received will go straight to his PayPal account immediately to help him get established before the baby arrives.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, the next best way to help is to share this page far and wide. They need our help now and the only way they'll get that help is if people know they need it.

story:
Check out the images in our gallery to see some behind the scenes shots of the work that goes into generating the next generation of cooling technology! 

For more info on how the MACS works, check out the video section!

Got questions or want more info? Post in the comments section!

MACS Application #3:

Similar to car engines, some amount of the energy produced by a plane’s engines must be used to keep those engines cool. In this case, the MACS present a highly efficient solution to increase the fuel efficiency of planes (and lower your ticket prices). Though we’re talking about a larger scale engine in this case, the design of the MACS means it can essentially be stacked to any size, making it extremely adaptable.

There’s another benefit on planes to consider. At 30,000 feet, the air is much cooler than it is at ground level. Because heat conduction depends on a temperature difference, the efficiency of the MACS is enhanced because heat is being removed into a far cooler environment. Using the MACS, an efficiency at least 4, possible even 5 times greater than conventional systems could be achieved. 

 ____________________________________________________________

Across the board, we as a society currently invest a significant amount of energy to creating a cooling infrastructure (ever wondered why your iPhone/iPad/Android gets so hot?). Aggressive shrinking of circuit components has created a situation in which traditional cooling methods simply cannot perform efficiently due to the high density of heat-producing components. As such, cooling technology is in dire need of innovation to address these issues that only continue getting worse. We've developed a micro-scale cooler we call the Micro Air Cycle System (MACS) to help.

The MACS is a fascinating new mesoscopic-MEMS enabled compressor that promises to revolutionize the cooling industry. The potential for high efficiency operation of the MACS answers the problems faced by current cooling technology, which has not had a major breakthrough in years.  The core component of the technology is an electrostatically compressed vane that can be replicated and stacked to fit a variety of shapes and sizes. Essentially, we've developed something on the small scale which runs completely differently than anything out there. 

Because it relies on a different method of heat transfer than traditional cooling methods, the MACS can vastly improve upon the current efficiencies. Theory suggests the MACS can be more than 4x better than any conventional system today! This amounts to a drastic reduction in energy consumption with no loss in cooling capacity! To put it in perspective, batteries in many devices (computers, cars, laptops) could easily last twice as long as they do now. 

 

Who are we?

We're two former students from the University of Texas at Dallas who have been working on this since 2010. We dedicated years of our lives and thousands of hours to moving it from an idea to a prototype. The MACS is a lot more than just a project for us, it's a passion that we've stuck with over 6 continents, 4 degrees in Electrical Engineering, and an utterly ridiculous amount of Chipotle (with some Freebirds mixed in for good measure).

 

How far along is the MACS?

In Summer 2012, a major milestone for the MACS was reached with the first successful measurement of the ability of a vane stack to measure cooling. We're super excited about the progress that can be made by improving the manufacturing process to create more uniform vanes and reduce errors throughout the process. While these vanes represent approximately 7% of the theoretical value, manufacturing improvements can increase this figure by at least an order of magnitude.

We feel that we can move the MACS towards market rapidly, as a number of small changes can create vast improvements in the efficiency of the MACS. By taking advantage of already existing manufacturing technology, we can quickly begin to manufacture full-sized vane stacks and test them for real world applications.

 

MACS Advantage

Compared to more conventional cooling methods, the MACS is a better solution. Compared to a legacy HVAC system, the MACS can be several times more efficient due to the low amount of energy necessary to drive compression and the ability to recover a large amount of the energy used. Because air conditioning represents a significant portion of energy usage, this efficiency boost will lower energy costs and conserve scarce resources. In addition, the MACS is a clean system. While conventional cooling systems have relied on some form of refrigerant (i.e., Freon) for cooling, the MACS uses no chemicals. That means the MACS provides a double bonus for the environment!

 

What will the money be used for? 

1)      Improved Drive Circuit

An integral part of ensuring the high efficiency of the MACS is to develop a drive circuit that reuses as much of the input energy as possible. The vane stack functions as two sets of alternately charging and discharging capacitors. This means that a high percentage of the energy used for compression of one half of the vanes can be recycled to compress the other half of the vanes, minimizing the power usage.

During Fall 2013 and Spring 2014, we will be sponsoring a Senior Design team to redesign the drive circuit to meet our goals of at least 70% charge recovery. In order to allow them to follow the circuit through the entire development process, we will need funding to purchase PCBs, components, and casing.

2)      Vane Design Optimization

While we have demonstrated that the MACS concept is valid, there are still a number of areas that can be explored to increase the amount of cooling generated by the MACS per compression cycle. For example, we know that vane spacing plays a significant role in the efficiency of the system, but also would like to know how shape and area can influence the movement of heat in the system. Adequate funding will allow us to hire the personnel necessary to fully explore the ideal vane geometry through modeling and testing. With this knowledge, we can tune the system design and operating conditions to achieve the highest efficiency.

3)      Improved Manufacturing Process

Wondering why our photos look like a bunch of super-cool sets of crinkly copper sheets? It's because we've built every prototype so far by hand. With increased funds, we will be able to gain access to manufacturers with the tools necessary to realize a full scale version of the MACS.

Having access to these manufacturers is key for us to implement full scale versions of the MACS. The cost to acquire this equipment ourselves would be enormous. However, we have already begun discussions with several companies to form partnerships that will allow us to move forward with MACS production.

4)      Production!

With the remaining details ironed out, the MACS will be in a position for production and implementation in all sorts of cool and exciting applications.

In order to allow them to follow the circuit through the entire development process, we will need funding to purchase PCBs, components, and casing.

Adequate funding will allow us to hire the personnel necessary to fully explore the ideal vane geometry through modeling and testing. With this knowledge, we can tune the system design and operating conditions to achieve the highest efficiency.
3)      Improved Manufacturing ProcessWondering why our photos look like a bunch of super-cool sets of crinkly copper sheets? It's because we've built every prototype so far by hand. With increased funds, we will be able to gain access to manufacturers with the tools necessary to realize a full scale version of the MACS.
Having access to these manufacturers is key for us to implement full scale versions of the MACS. The cost to acquire this equipment ourselves would be enormous. However, we have already begun discussions with several companies to form partnerships that will allow us to move forward with MACS production.
4)      Production!With the remaining details ironed out, the MACS will be in a position for production and implementation in all sorts of cool and exciting applications.

story:
Hello!

GK Series is our first line of products. It is composed by GKILO, a wood-like kitchen scale, and CLOGK, a timer with touch interface. 

GKILO is a dual clock and kitchen scale. Resting on one side, the LED numbers act as a scale, displaying  the weight of any objects placed on it. Flip the GKILO over, and the lights will display the current time. Using simple hand motions, users can easily reset the scale or adjust the time. In stand-by mode the object can be used as paperweight or shelf.  
CLOGK is a modern take on the everyday clock. At rest, the CLOGK acts as an eye catching and modern  decorative piece or paperweight. When activated by touch, the wood-like CLOGK displays an analog clock or  cooking timer.  

Each Thingk product is developed to be Wireless ready, and in case of great success we are thinking to a stretch goal to supply the wireless module built-in in our products. Moreover, our objects are open-hardware products, so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project.  




With this campaign, we would like to bring our first line of products, GK Series, to the next level: we are now in the prototype phase and we hope to switch from prototypes to products. Moreover, we want demonstrate that it's time for a new class of devices, born for the Internet of Things era.
However, GK series is only the first step towards our dream: revolutionize everyday products, adding internet of things and natural User interfaces. 

Combining these skills, Thingk enters in the next Era of med-tech objects, that will be smart, cool and thought for modern User Experience.
We attended the first European Maker Faire in Rome, October 3-6, 2013. Moreover, we won Switch2Product competition 2013, entering in Polihub, startup incubator funded by Politecnico di Milano. Previous Polihub startups were Fabtotum and Ginko Umbrella that experienced successfull crowdfunding campaigns on Indiegogo.

Last, we attended Milan Design Week 2014, one of the most important event in the world dedicated to Design objects. 

Thingk interview at LiveOn4G, during Milan Design Week 2014.
English subtitles available: click on CC symbol on bottom right.





__________________________________________________________________________
Products

GK Series, our first line of products, is composed by GKILO, a wood-like kitchen scale, and CLOGK, a timer with touch interface.

GKILO

GKILO is a dual clock and kitchen scale. Resting on one side, the LED numbers act as a scale, displaying  the weight of any objects placed on it. Flip the GKILO over, and the lights will display the current time. Using simple hand motions, users can easily reset the scale or adjust the time. In stand-by mode the object can be used as paperweight or shelf. A wireless module will ensure the possibility of interact with other Thingk products (for example CLOGK) and with an app (for Android, iOS). Wireless add-on completes the functionality of our devices: through an app you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time for that food and for that weight. The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both of them will stop to blink. Each Thingk product is developed to be Wireless ready, and in case of great success we are thinking to a stretch goal to supply the wireless module built-in in our products. Moreover, our objects are open-hardware products, so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project.



Technical characteristics
Dimensions: 300x210x50 mm
Weight: 600 g
Mechanical structure in high-quality plexiglass
Wood-like adhesive material
Backlight LED matrix, cool white, high luminosity
Touch sensor based on capacitive technology
Hardware based on Arduino platform
Weight resolution: 2 g
Full scale range: 0 to 2500 g
Time resolution: 1 second
Time accuracy: 20 ppm
Power supply: 4x AA bbattery
Operating temperature: 0° to 35° C
Nonoperating temperature: -20° to 45° C
Relative humidity: 5% to 95% noncondensing
Maximum operating altitude: 3000 m

CLOGK

CLOGK is a modern take on the everyday clock. At rest, the CLOGK acts as an eye catching and modern  decorative piece or paperweight. When activated by touch, the wooden CLOGK displays an analog clock or  cooking timer. CLOGK possesses wireless capabilities as well, and can connect to both the web app and to  GKILO. A wireless module will ensure the possibility of interact with other Thingk products (for example GKILO) and with an app (for Android, iOS). Wireless add-on completes the functionality of our devices: through an app (Android, iOS) you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time for that food and for that weight. The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both of them will stop to blink. Each Thingk product is developed to be Wireless ready, and in case of great success we are thinking to a stretch goal to supply the wireless module built-in in our products. Moreover, our objects are open-hardware products, so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project. 

Technical characteristics
Dimensions: 160x130mm, 20° tilt
Weight: 500 g
Unibody Mechanical structure
Wood-like adhesive material
Backlight LED matrix, cool white, 1200mcd lumiinosity
Touch sensor based on capacitive technology
Time resolution: 1 s
Time accuracy: 20 ppm
Hardware based on Arduino platform
Power supply: 4x AA bbattery
Operating temperature: 0° to 35° C
Nonoperating temperature: -20° to 45° C
Relative humidity: 5% to 95% noncondensing
Maximum operating altitude: 3000 m

Finishing

Thanks to the top quality material that we use for the final coating of our objects, produced by 3M (the worldwide leader in this market segment) we can offer 4 different finishing: fair wood, burnt wood, marble and aluminium.


PCB Core
GKILO and CLOGK are based on an electronic board, developed by our team of engineers and based on Arduino platform. We love Arduino and we strongly believe in Open Source Hardware, so we took the best from this platform (wide range of libraries, huge community for help and tips, programming easiness), adding to our board some characteristics specifically thought for Natural User interfaces. For example, PCB Core is able to manage several touch buttons, it has a precision ADC, with an integrated INA, for very small signal measurements, it has an inclinometer on board and it is ready for temperature measurements.  

Main characteristics
Dual Layer
Dimension: 95.8 x 41.8mm
MicroController ATMEGA328P-AU, AVR 32K FLASH
4 touch buttons management
Inclinometer
18-bit delta-sigma ADC with integrated INA
Temperature sensor
FTDI on board for easy programming and communication

__________________________________________________________________________

The Perks


__________________________________________________________________________
Stretch goals

_
If we will reach the goal (50.000 USD), we will be able to start the production of our first products, GKILO and CLOGK.
_
Starting from 100.000 USD goal, we will be able to offer a choice between two different wood textures.
_
Starting from 150.000 USD, we will switch from a 3D-printed structure to an injection molded structure. This will allow superior reliability to the objects, assuring high reliability to our objects.
_
Starting from 200.000 USD goal, we will include in our devices also the wireless add-on. Thanks to this, GKILO and CLOGK will talk each other and with an app (iOS and Android): you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time for that food and for that weight. The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both of them will stop to blink.

Please help us to reach the higher goal and we will have a lot of surprises for you!

________________________________________________________________________

Who we are


THINGK is an italian startup, with a development team composed by 5 guys with different skills: Stefano Marangoni (32), Andrea Gallivanoni (35) and Giuseppe Valenti (32) are Electronic Engineers with passion for design, innovation and personal fabrication, Umberto Tolino (37) is a Designer with long experience in Visual Communication and Industrial Design, Domenico Cosentino (38) is the Software wizard, with focus on web development and mobile-apps. The entire development team comes from University of Politecnico di Milano, one of the most renowned european universities in Engineering, Architecture and Industrial Design since 1863

Our collaboration started with the production and realization of a clock to celebrate the new model of Adidas Profi. Designed by Pomo (designer), completely developed (materials and technology) by Thingk, the  clock recalls a basketball game: dimensions of the clock are the same of a basketball shoebox, the clock is covered with a synthetic material emulating the wood of the parquet and the circular LEDs indicating the hour and minutes recalls the scoreboard.

The hardware was based on Arduino platform, the PCBs was realized with Sparkle-PCB, the mechanical structure was realized in plexiglass glued by hand,  the wood-like adhesive material is cutted with laser cutter.
The clock was distributed in 50 Adidas Originals Stores in Italy. This project gave us the opportunity to understand that the world of med-tech objects is out of date: user interfaces with too many buttons, poor materials and no attention to Design. Starting from this consideration, we developed our vision.

__________________________________________________________________________

Our Manifesto

We are what we think.

We are tired of dumb objects, of inanimate pieces, of single-function products.

We believe in elegance and beauty.

We are the the ideas we share, not the ones we keep secret.

We want to interact intelligently with everything we have around us, because this is our way of life: fast, mobile, parallel.

We are extreme, but willing to listen.

We believe that job society is finished. We believe interaction society has started.

We are the evolution of the species. We are the new men with the club and our club is irony.

We are immersed in technology, but we are not slaves, we are interpreters.

We are the ones that when someone say "Stop daydreaming", answer "You told me to stop breathing".

We are proud of our past, but we believe, think and live in the future.

We are constantly changing, because the ability to adapt to our time is what characterizes us.

We are a mass, not an elite. It may not look like it, because we are widespread, not concentrated.

You have to observe from above to understand us.

We would like only one epitaph: "They had every right to teach, because they spent all their time learning".

__________________________________________________________________________

Why a crowdfunding campaign

We are a little team with no established company behind with huge funds to invest. Moreover, many venture capitals are still reluctant to invest in hardware startup, since hardware projects has bigger scalability issues, related to distribution, and big fixed costs related to production in big volume. For these reasons, we need your help to produce the first batch of our products: the raised money will be used for the purchase of PCBs, electronic components, for the adhesive material and for the construction of mechanical structure. The entire production flow will be made in Italy, assuring the best quality in all the phases of production. We hope to reach the goal in this campaign, demonstrating that the market is ready for this kind of devices. Last, a crowfunding campaign represents for us a good check, in order to understand the real interest around the world for our products and allowing us to construct a growing community around our project. The community is very importnat for us, because our products will be open hardware so that anyone can modify them, creating a customized version.

__________________________________________________________________________

Risk and challenge

As with all crowdfunding campaigns there are risks and challenges. Delivering a tech product is not easy task and GKILO+CLOGK are a blend of several parts, requiring a good level of engineering and system integration, together with craft skill. We think we have a solid project, we demonstrated it with our prototype.
From a software standpoint we are developing the app to control our devices and every suggestion on new functionalities is appreciated. We want to reach everyone, so we are studying also the SDK for Windows Phone, not only for Android and iPhone, well known by our Software Wizard, Domenico Cosentino. Our challenge will be to successfully organize the supply line, from a good number of suppliers. Finally we'll succeed in scaling the production up (after delivering to our backers) only if we'll be able to increase our team size.
Known risks are:
- Higher production prices due to few units sold, increasing the number of components we have to preorder, reducing our resources.
- System integrations (especially software/electronics) might require more time than expected.

__________________________________________________________________________

Qualification

Our products are constituted mainly by two parts: electronics and design. Regarding electronic, we have a team of 3 people with a deep knowledge of analog/digital hardware. In fact our Hardware team is coming from Electronic Department of Politecnico di Milano, that is the biggest Electronic department in Europe. Moreover, two guys of the team carried out also research activities in this field, with about 20 articles published on international scientific journals.
Additional info here:
Linkedin profile of Stefano Marangoni
Linkedin profile of Giuseppe Valenti
Linkedin profile of Andrea Gallivanoni

Regarding Design, in our team we have an Interaction Designer with long experience. Graduated in Industrial Design with a thesis in collaboration with Philips design, since 2001 is co-founder of rnd_lab, developing several products, published on many Design magazines. He was selected in two edition of ADI Design Index for “Compasso d’Oro” prize, and he participated to the exhibit “the new Italian design” at Triennale di Milano with wall-clock “rnd_time”. Since 2011, he is teaching Visual Communication for master and degree courses at Politecnico di Milano.
Additional info here:
Profile of Umberto Tolino

__________________________________________________________________________

FAQ

Why the shipping costs are not included in the perks?
Shipping costs may vary depending on the location and country. It is easier to handle shipping separately.  

How much will shipping cost me?
Since we are based in Italy, we can guarantee free shipping to Italian backers, a shipping cost of 15 USD for European guys and a cost of 20 USD for extra-european funders.

What freight carrier do you use?
For shipping we use UPS (United Parcel Service), http://www.ups.com/.

What do I have to do with Coupons?
You can redeem them in our on-line shop (soon to be open on thin-gk.com).It’s a personal, single-use code. We suggest you to save it or print it and keep it somewhere safe. Once redeemed the coupon expires. 

Can I preorder Thingk Products?
All backers (except who already got a GKILO or CLOGK) will receive a email to place a order before the store opens. The shipping order will be based on the backer contribution date. If you backed this project early you can place your order as late as possible (preorder windows) and still be in the front line before non-backers!

 so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project. 
   









With this campaign, we would like to bring our first line of products, GK Series, to the next level: 
we are now in the prototype phase and we hope to switch from prototypes to products. Moreover, we want demonstrate that it's time for a new class of devices, 
born for the Internet of Things era.However, GK series is only the first step towards our dream: revolutionize everyday products, adding internet of things and natural User interfaces.  Combining these skills, Thingk enters in the next Era of med-tech objects, that will be smart, cool and thought for modern User Experience. We attended the first European Maker Faire in Rome, October 3-6, 2013. Moreover, we won Switch2Product competition 2013, entering in Polihub, startup incubator funded by Politecnico di Milano. 
Previous Polihub startups were Fabtotum and Ginko Umbrella that experienced successfull crowdfunding campaigns on Indiegogo.



Last, we attended Milan Design Week 2014, one of the most important event in the world dedicated to Design objects. 
Thingk interview at LiveOn4G, during Milan Design Week 2014. English subtitles available: click on CC symbol on bottom right.

__________________________________________________________________________Products
GK Series, our first line of products, is composed by GKILO, a wood-like kitchen scale, and CLOGK, a timer with touch interface. 


GKILO

GKILO is a dual clock and kitchen scale. Resting on one side, the LED numbers act as a scale, displaying 
the weight of any objects placed on it. Flip the GKILO over, and the lights will display the current time. Using simple hand motions, users can easily reset the scale or adjust the time. In stand-by mode the object can be used as paperweight or shelf. A wireless module will ensure the possibility of interact with other Thingk products (for example CLOGK) and with an app 
(for Android, iOS). Wireless add-on completes the functionality of our devices: through an app you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time for that food and for that weight.
 The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both of them will stop to blink. 
 Each Thingk product is developed to be Wireless ready, and in case of great success we are thinking to a stretch goal to supply the wireless module built-in in our products. Moreover, our objects are open-hardware products, 
 so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project. 



Technical characteristicsDimensions: 300x210x50 mmWeight: 600 gMechanical structure in high-quality plexiglassWood-like adhesive materialBacklight LED matrix, cool white, high luminosityTouch sensor based on capacitive technologyHardware based on Arduino platformWeight resolution: 2 gFull scale range: 0 to 2500 gTime resolution: 1 secondTime accuracy: 20 ppmPower supply: 4x AA bbatteryOperating temperature: 0° to 35° CNonoperating temperature: -20° to 45° CRelative humidity: 5% to 95% noncondensingMaximum operating altitude: 3000 mCLOGK



CLOGK is a modern take on the everyday clock. At rest, the CLOGK acts as an eye catching and modern  
decorative piece or paperweight. When activated by touch, the wooden CLOGK displays an analog clock or 
cooking timer. CLOGK possesses wireless capabilities as well, and can connect to both the web app and to 
 GKILO. A wireless module will ensure the possibility of interact with other Thingk products (for example GKILO) and 
 with an app (for Android, iOS). Wireless add-on completes the functionality of our devices: through an app (Android, iOS) you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time 
 for that food and for that weight. The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both 
 of them will stop to blink. Each Thingk product is developed to be Wireless ready, and in case of great success we are thinking to a stretch goal to supply the wireless module built-in in our products. Moreover, our objects 
 are open-hardware products, so you can wait our add-on or you can make your own wireless add-on, basing on our project. 
 








Technical characteristicsDimensions: 160x130mm, 20° tiltWeight: 500 gUnibody Mechanical structure Wood-like adhesive materialBacklight LED matrix, cool white, 1200mcd lumiinosityTouch sensor based on capacitive technologyTime resolution: 1 sTime accuracy: 20 ppmHardware based on Arduino platformPower supply: 4x AA bbatteryOperating temperature: 0° to 35° CNonoperating temperature: -20° to 45° CRelative humidity: 5% to 95% noncondensingMaximum operating altitude: 3000 m
Finishing

Thanks to the top quality material that we use for the final coating of our objects, produced by 3M (the worldwide leader in this market segment) we can offer 4 different finishing: fair wood, burnt wood, marble and aluminium.


PCB CoreGKILO and CLOGK are based on an electronic board, developed by our team of engineers and based on Arduino platform. We love Arduino and we strongly believe in Open Source Hardware, so we took the best from this platform (wide range of libraries, huge community for help and tips, programming easiness), adding to our board some characteristics specifically thought for Natural User interfaces. For example, PCB Core is able to manage several touch buttons, it has a precision ADC, with an integrated INA, for very small signal measurements, it has an inclinometer on board and it is ready for temperature measurements.  Main characteristicsDual LayerDimension: 95.8 x 41.8mm MicroController ATMEGA328P-AU, AVR 32K FLASH4 touch buttons management Inclinometer 18-bit delta-sigma ADC with integrated INATemperature sensorFTDI on board for easy programming and communication
__________________________________________________________________________
The Perks

 






















__________________________________________________________________________Stretch goals_If we will reach the goal (50.000 USD), we will be able to start the production of our first 
 products, GKILO and CLOGK. _Starting from 100.000 USD goal, we will be able to offer a choice between two different wood 
 textures. _Starting from 150.000 USD, we will switch from a 3D-printed structure to an injection molded 
 structure. This will allow superior reliability to the objects, assuring high reliability to our objects._Starting from 200.000 USD goal, we will include in our devices also the wireless add-on. 
 Thanks to this, GKILO and CLOGK will talk each other and with an app (iOS and Android): you will choose the food you are weighing, and automatically the app will propose the cooking time for that food and for that weight. 
 The app will interact with CLOGK, setting the timer on the appropriate countdown. At the end of the countdown, CLOGK and GKILO will blink together and touching one of these devices, both of them will stop to 
 blink.Please help us to reach the higher goal and we will have a lot of surprises for you!






________________________________________________________________________Who we are









THINGK is an italian startup, with a development team composed by 5 guys with different skills: 
 Stefano Marangoni (32), Andrea Gallivanoni (35) and Giuseppe Valenti (32) are Electronic Engineers with passion for design, innovation and personal fabrication, Umberto Tolino (37) is a Designer with long experience 
 in Visual Communication and Industrial Design, Domenico Cosentino (38) is the Software wizard, with focus on web development and mobile-apps. The entire development team comes from University of Politecnico di Milano, one of the most renowned european universities in Engineering, Architecture and Industrial Design since 1863
 

Our collaboration started with the production and realization of a 
 clock to celebrate the new model of Adidas Profi. Designed by Pomo (designer), completely 
 developed (materials and technology) by Thingk, the  clock recalls a basketball game: dimensions of the clock are the same of a basketball shoebox, the clock is covered with a synthetic material emulating the wood of the parquet and the circular LEDs indicating the hour and minutes recalls the scoreboard.





The hardware was based on  Arduino platform, the PCBs was realized with Sparkle-PCB, the mechanical structure was realized 
 in plexiglass glued by hand,  the wood-like adhesive material is cutted with laser cutter. The clock was distributed in 50 Adidas Originals Stores in Italy. This project gave us the opportunity 
 to understand that the world of med-tech objects is out of date: user interfaces with too many buttons, poor materials and no attention to Design. Starting from this consideration, we developed our 
 vision. 

__________________________________________________________________________Our Manifesto
We are what we think.
We are tired of dumb objects, of inanimate pieces, of single-function products.
We believe in elegance and beauty.
We are the the ideas we share, not the ones we keep secret.
We want to interact intelligently with everything we have around us, because this is our way of life: fast, mobile, 
parallel.
We are extreme, but willing to listen.
We believe that job society is finished. We believe interaction society has started.
We are the evolution of the species. We are the new men with the club and our club is irony.
We are immersed in technology, but we are not slaves, we are interpreters.
We are the ones that when someone say "Stop daydreaming", answer "You told me to stop breathing".
We are proud of our past, but we believe, think and live in the future.
We are constantly changing, because the ability to adapt to our time is what characterizes us.
We are a mass, not an elite. It may not look like it, because we are widespread, not concentrated.
You have to observe from above to understand us.
We would like only one epitaph: "They had every right to teach, because they spent all their time learning".

__________________________________________________________________________Why a crowdfunding campaign
We are a little team with no established company behind with huge funds to invest. Moreover, many venture capitals are still reluctant to invest in hardware startup, since hardware projects has bigger scalability 
issues, related to distribution, and big fixed costs related to production in big volume. For these reasons, we need your help to produce the first batch of our products: the raised money will be used for the 
purchase of PCBs, electronic components, for the adhesive material and for the construction of mechanical structure. The entire production flow will be made in Italy, assuring the best quality in all the phases 
of production. We hope to reach the goal in this campaign, demonstrating that the market is ready for this kind of devices. Last, a crowfunding campaign represents for us a good check, in order 
to understand the real interest around the world for our products and allowing us to construct a growing community around our project. The community is very importnat for us, because our products will be open hardware 
so that anyone can modify them, creating a customized version.

__________________________________________________________________________Risk and challenge
As with all crowdfunding campaigns there are risks and challenges. 
Delivering a tech product is not easy task and GKILO+CLOGK are a blend of several parts, requiring a good level of engineering and system integration, together with craft skill.
We think we have a solid project, we demonstrated it with our prototype. 
From a software standpoint we are developing the app to control our devices and every suggestion on new functionalities is appreciated. We want to reach everyone, so we are studying 
also the SDK for Windows Phone, not only for Android and iPhone, well known by our Software Wizard, Domenico Cosentino.
Our challenge will be  to successfully organize the supply line, from a good number of suppliers.
Finally we'll succeed in scaling the production up (after delivering to our backers) only if we'll be able to increase our team size.

Known risks are:

- Higher production prices due to few units sold, increasing the number of components we have to preorder, reducing our resources.

- System integrations (especially software/electronics) might require more time than expected.

__________________________________________________________________________Qualification

Our products are constituted mainly by two parts: electronics and design.
Regarding electronic, we have a team of 3 people with a deep knowledge of analog/digital hardware. In fact our Hardware team is coming from Electronic Department of Politecnico di Milano, that is 
the biggest Electronic department in Europe. Moreover, two guys of the team carried out also research activities in this field, with about 20 articles published on international scientific journals.

Additional info here:
Linkedin profile of Stefano Marangoni
Linkedin profile of Giuseppe Valenti
Linkedin profile of Andrea Gallivanoni

 
Regarding Design, in our team we have an Interaction Designer with long experience. Graduated in Industrial Design with a thesis in collaboration with Philips design, since 2001 is co-founder of 
rnd_lab, developing several products, published on many Design magazines. He was selected in two edition of ADI Design Index for “Compasso d’Oro” prize, and he participated to the exhibit 
“the new Italian design” at Triennale di Milano with wall-clock “rnd_time”. Since 2011, he is teaching Visual Communication for master and degree courses at Politecnico di Milano.

Additional info here:
Profile of Umberto Tolino


__________________________________________________________________________FAQ

Why the shipping costs are not included in the perks?

Shipping costs may vary depending on the location and country. 
It is easier to handle shipping separately.  

How much will shipping cost me?

Since we are based in Italy, we can guarantee free shipping to Italian backers, a shipping cost of 15 USD for European guys 
and a cost of 20 USD for extra-european 
funders.

What freight carrier do you use?

For shipping we use UPS (United Parcel Service), http://www.ups.com/.

What do I have to do with Coupons?

You can redeem them in our on-line shop (soon to be open on thin-gk.com).It’s a personal, single-use code. We suggest you to save it or print it and keep it somewhere safe.
Once redeemed the coupon expires. 
Can I preorder Thingk Products?

All backers (except who already got a GKILO or CLOGK) will receive a email to place a order before the store opens.
The shipping order will be based on the backer contribution date. If you backed this project early you can place your order as late as possible (preorder windows) 
and still be in the front line before non-backers!

story:
SMART CHRISTMAS MUSIC LIGHTS

Christmas every year is a wonderful holiday to look forward to, spending time with your loved ones and creating wonderful memories. We have created a product that will add to that joy and cheer, with a fun and easy-to-use interface. The Smart Christmas Music Lights include fully customizable lights, a free app download, and a powerful speaker. Enjoy the pre-loaded holiday classics while the lights dance along to the songs, or play music from your own library! Our free app gives you full control of the color of the lights with a color wheel to choose from and preset color schemes. As an added bonus, we include fun and festive sound effects to bring laughter and smiles to your home.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

We need your help to make this project happen. We're in the home stretch! Your contributions will go towards perfecting the technology, app development, marketing, and shipping. Our unique and patented technology makes the customizable and dancing lights possible.

We all know how difficult it can be to plan a Christmas party, with family visiting, wrapping all the gifts, making dinner, and of course, setting up all of the Christmas decorations. The purpose of this product is to make it easier for you to prepare for the holidays, that way you can spend more time with your loved ones. The customizable lights can adapt to any theme for your Christmas tree, just pick any option from the color wheel! Also, you no longer have to worry about making a Christmas playlist for the party, just used the pre-loaded music in the app!

WHAT IS INCLUDED WITH SMART CHRISTMAS MUSIC LIGHTS?

• One set of lights

• One powerful speaker

• Free app download

• Free shipping (US only)

BLUETOOTH TECHNOLOGY

The Smart Christmas Music Lights connect to your iOS or Android smartphone via Bluetooth, so it is easier for you to stay connected without Wi-Fi or data usage.

THE APP

•Free download with product

• Pick any color from the color wheel for your lights

• Pick any preset color schemes

•Play music from your own library

•Plays sound effects for more laughter and fun!

•Play music from the 25 pre-loaded holiday classics, including:

         • Jingle Bell Rock

         • Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer

         • Deck the Halls

         • Santa Baby

         • White Christmas

         • I'll Be Home For Christmas

         • Silent Night

         • Little Drummer Boy

         • Feliz Navidad

         • Jingle Bells

         • Holly Jolly Christmas

         • O Christmas Tree

         • Greensleeves

         • Winter Wonderland

         • And many more!

THANK YOU!

Spread the holiday cheer, share this project with your friends and family!

story:
With Teodoor, your smartphone becomes your new door key. It installs easily on the inside of your existing lock on a wide variety of doors, providing you with a complete, personal smart lock experience – in truly hands-free fashion. Using state of the art security, user-friendly installation and a well-thought app, while at the same time having a compact footprint with a sleek design.

     

 
Teodoor is designed to complement and complete your main entrance. It’s powered by replaceable lithium batteries and employs the latest Bluetooth technology to deliver a smart and secure home life solution. Teodoor unlocks your door  – all by himself.
 

You can still use your key, your door retains its prime function. But now you have tons of options to go along.
  

 
  

 
We found the perfect formula while investing over 2 years of our time on research and development and by witnessing the current smart lock experience first hand.
 

 
 

 
Teodoor delivers truly hands-free service (unlike many that boast the same yet fail to deliver). Using a complex set of specific algorithms it determines when you’re approaching your door to unlock it, and does it for you. And just like a good doorman, it also locks the door behind you.
 
 

 
 

 
Teodoor senses any door movement when it’s locked and should be secure. You’ll receive a notification anywhere in the world (with the optional Wi-Fi adapter) if anyone tries to force your door open. And when it’s set to Vacation Mode, you’re notified of any activity whatsoever. 

 

 
 

 
The Teodoor app will be available for free on the App Store and Google Play Store. It allows you to give others access rights quickly and easily (regular or restricted access, you decide). The detailed scheduled access functions can be applied in a variety of situations: daily nanny, weekly cleaner, one-time visits and more. And it's highly convenient for bed and breakfast proprietors.
 

 
  

 
Teodoor is flexible, and perfectly happy with a human touch, so it can be turned manually, just like any regular doorknob. In case you ignored that pesky low-battery notification (or just forgot your phone) you can still use the lock. Pretty handy, right?

You can always use your existing keys to unlock your door in case you don't have your smartphone with you.
 

 

  

  
Teodoor is designed to be contemporary yet timeless, refined yet subdued, so it pairs well with any door it’s matched up with. The battery cover and the inner/mounting ring are precisely milled to perfection from aluminium or brass, next to the grooved, easy-grip shaft. 
 

 
Teodoor is available in three color finishes: Pebble Silver, Midnight Black, and Luxor Gold.
 

  
 
 

 

  
Teodoor was designed to be modular and easy to install. Setup is straightforward and takes only minutes (European installation is even faster, and done in seconds). It simply fits on the inside of your front (or other) door, right on your existing door hardware.  

 

UPDATE: Teodoor now supports Swiss cylinders!

This smart lock is compatible with most single cylinder deadbolts (common in North America) and all European cylinder locks. If you’re not sure about compatibility, leave a comment (or send us an email) and include with your lock model (an image is always a plus) and we’ll help you out. 

We’ve tested Teodoor with deadbolts from the following manufacturers: Schlage, Kwikset, Baldwin, Defiant, Weiser, Omnia, and Emtek.
 

 

Here's a Teodoor installation demo, done in a couple of seconds. 
 

 
 
 

Teodoor uses the latest military grade encryption technologies which are also commonly used in online banking transactions. Our Bluetooth 5 capable chip (compatible with Bluetooth 4) has an additional cryptographic co-processor to enable usage of more sophisticated and safer encryption algorithms while using less processing time.

By doing that it also lowers energy consumption, so Teodoor can keep locking and unlocking your door for longer.

We are not using a central based storage system (the shared encryption key never hits our servers), so even we (or malicious hackers) cannot unlock your door.

Only Teodoor and your phone app have access to your lock.

  
 
 

 
You can select the way Teodoor works for your home. Locally, being in close proximity, or globally from anywhere in the world using our specially designed Wi-Fi adapter.
 

 
The optional Wi-Fi adapter enables you to access Teodoor safely via the internet any time. Teodoor works perfectly without, and you can always upgrade later. The Wi-Fi adapter requires a wireless internet connection, a power source, and must be in the general proximity of Teodoor in order to communicate properly (approx. 30 ft or 10 m).
 

 
The Wi-Fi Adapter is available with two different socket plugs: type A (widely used in North and Central America), and type C (rest of the world). 

 
 

 

 
 
Along with Teodoor, you will receive a set batteries (CR123A - commonly sold worldwide) that will last for over a year. Teodoor sends you a notification when they are almost empty. Swapping them is a breeze.

 

  
 

 

 

We’ve developed several prototypes over the past two years to ensure we can deliver the best experience possible, before coming to Kickstarter. No empty promises!
 

 
Below is a demo of our prototypes, showing locking/unlocking via the testing app, then manually unlocking and locking. The second video shows hands-free unlocking.


 

 

 
 

 

 
 
 

 
We're a young team of experts, a collective of developers and creatives, who trusts to have built the best and most sophisticated smart lock on the market. We trust to deliver what the costumer needs. Through hard work and long working hours we managed to get to this point

 
Our vision is to bring Teodoor on every front door, in spite of all different locking standards out there.

Kind thanks to our advisors and partners.

The team:

Martin Koterle, Kristjan Ugrin, Žiga Godina, Rok Kozel, Nejc Matjaž, Miha Prijatelj, Jan Jagodič, Rok Pernus, Grega Logar, Radovan Obal, Melana Kreslin, Samo Novinšek, Rikardo Komen.

Special thanks to:

Marko Koterle, Mak Kordić, Karim Shalaby, Anže Miklavec, Niko Klanšek, Blaž Zupan, Nastja Šimunić.

 We're a young team of experts, a collective of developers and creatives, who trusts to have built the best and most sophisticated smart lock on the market. We trust to deliver what the costumer needs. Through hard work and long working hours we managed to get to this point

Kind thanks to our advisors and partners.

story:
Evolution of the Multi-Outlet

In an increasingly digital world, more and more electronic devices find their way into our home and office spaces. Traditionally, people use multiple power strips to manage their devices, but this method creates space-consuming and unsightly clutter, especially if your devices require different methods of charging. 

The Brunt Powerstation is designed to solve these inconveniences and provide a clean, visually appealing environment. The AC sockets are strategically placed in the back to minimize cord clutter, and the front rack provides an aesthetic visual shield. In addition, the Powerstation integrates various methods of charging into one sleek package, providing a range of flexible and organized sources of electricity. 

 

 

 

 

 

The Brunt Powerstation is a multifunctional charging stand meant to make desk life more organised and convenient. It features a carefully researched 60 degree angle tilt to allow for easy plug connection from any position. 

 

3 AC Sockets

  • Support universal plug types

​

 

 

2 USB Charging Ports

  • ​Feature a built-in module approximately twice as fast as the conventional charger
 

 

 

1 Wireless Charger

  • 3 embedded wireless charging coils to easily power your smartphone in any direction

 

​

  • Horizontal charging position supports from Galaxy Note size.
  • Wireless charging perfectly work with smart phone without phone cases but if cases are flat surface and slim design, these can be used without any problems. (In case of using cases has uneven surface or too thick, these may not work with wireless charging.)

  

** EXCLUSIVE DEAL for ALL BACKERS!! **

Don’t worry if your smartphone doesn’t support wireless charging; we’re giving all our backers a FREE wireless charging receiver!

EVERY backer can choose from two smartphone options before checkout: Lightning 8pin for iPhones, or Micro 5pin for Androids.

 
 
 

1 Embedded WiFi SmartPlug

 

One of the three universal AC sockets is equipped with a built-in SmartPlug that allows for remote control of your electronic device through the free Brunt mobile app. With the app, you can conveniently control the power of the connected device from anywhere, anytime.

 


 

 

Alexa Compatibility

 

The Brunt Powerstation can be controlled via Amazon Echo. Simply command, “Ask Mr. Brunt to turn the Powerstation on/off!”

 

 

Features of the Brunt App


 

  • Automatic Execution According to your Location

When used with the Brunt app, the Brunt Powerstation possesses auto-run capabilities. After setting location parameters, the Powerstation will automatically turn on when you approach the location, and automatically turn off when you leave.

 

 

Rack Design and Usage

The Brunt Powerstation is more than a simple electronic charging outlet. Designed with raw, industrial elegance, the Brunt Powerstation is also a practical interior design product that naturally integrates itself with surrounding furniture and home goods to combine functionality with art.

 

  • Book Stand

 

  • Laptop Stand

 

  • Picture Frame, Mobile Device Stand

 

 

Specifications


 

Backer Rewards



 

Stretch Goals


 

Timeline

 

 

 

Great debut in CES 2017! 

We introduced the 3rd prototype of the Brunt Powerstation at the 2017 CES tradeshow in Las Vegas. It was an incredible experience, and we truly appreciate everyone who came to our booth and gave us feedback about our products!

 


 

About Brunt

Brunt is a compound word formed from “Brush,” “Paint,” and “Technology.”

Brush and paint represent artistic creativity, while technology refers to our increasingly digital modern society. 

We create our products and services with these elements mind, striving to balance them together and create tools for a sophisticated, futuristic world. We are confident that Brunt products will greatly increase daily convenience and empower you in crafting your own unique lifestyle in the digital age. 

 

  • Team Members

Nam / CEO & Creative director
Nick / Server and F/W Engineering
Luka / Product design
JC / Product design
David / Graphic design
Gina / Finance & Operation
Jake / Business development
Jay / R&D Engineering
 

  • Official SNS
