story:
Ocean Plastic, Climate Change, a Clothespin and You.

Every day you make choices. Small choices that support your values. Small choices that build a life you want to live. Small choices that define you.

The choices you make every day, no matter how small, become the foundation of your world.

And today is no different.

Today, you have the choice to be a changemaker. A real changemaker.

Today, you can choose to reduce carbon emissions and help stabilize our atmospheric systems.

You can choose to support the interception of plastics from our oceans to ensure the foundation of our food chain is balanced and functional.

You can choose to help our oceans so they can keep supporting oxygen production for healthy air.

You can make one small choice and catalyze monumental change.

The kind of change that even a clothespin can make..

The NONA Recycled Ocean Plastic Clothespin is no ordinary clothespin.

Your little clothespin is an investment in cleaning up plastic pollution in our oceans. It is a symbol of your active fight against climate change. It’s your tool to personally save as much as 1 ton of CO2 emissions every year through hang-drying your clothes.

Your little clothespin is a totem to your commitment to the planet: our oceans; our air; our wildlife; our people.

Yes, it’s just a small investment. But your small investment helps us at NONA create monumental change. Change that we can’t create without you.

And yes, it’s just a clothespin. But this clothespin has a story. One, we’re hoping, you will help us tell.

Be the change you want to see in the world, with NONA; because - No Oceans, No Air.

The big problem with ocean micro-plastic.

MICRO PLASTICS. On the left, fish food. On the right, plastic. Photographed at Marine Biological Association, Plymouth, U.K. Photograph By David Liittschwager

 

Every year 8 million metric tonnes of plastic enters the worlds oceans, by 2050 ocean plastic will outweigh fish. 

Once there it breaks down into tiny particles called micro-plastic, these particles enter the food chain simultaneously poisoning our food supplies and damaging marine eco-systems.

When we consider that our every second breath was produced in the worlds oceans it becomes clear something must be done, because No Oceans, No Air.

NONA's mission.

OCEAN TURTLE TRAPPED IN 'GHOST FISHING GEAR' - Image credit WWF

 

Our mission is to reduce ocean plastic by producing well designed, durable everyday products.

The ocean plastic we use is sourced as a result of an interception program in place across various ports that reimburses fisherman for worn-out fishing gear. 

Your investment in NONA helps to support the circular economies dedicated to intercepting plastic, before it enters the ocean.

Introducing NONA Ocean Clothespin.

Practically unbreakable.

NONA Ocean Clothespin is a simple mono-form design which means that there are no moving parts to break, no springs to malfunction, it won’t rust, mould or degrade. 

Effortless to use.

NONA Ocean Clothespin swiftly glides on and smartly draws off, it's natural flexibility means it can adjust to hold all kinds of laundry. 

 

The unique wave feature offers grip strengths ranging from delicate though to strong, meaning NONA is highly effective even in strong winds.

Actively reduce your carbon footprint.

NONA Ocean Clothespin is more than an investment in cleaning up ocean plastic pollution. It’s a tool to personally save as much as 1 ton of CO2 emissions every year through hang-drying and because it's gentler your clothes will last longer too. 

Sunlight a known disinfectant.

Sunlight is known to kill pathogens including viruses and bacteria, meaning line-dried clothes are not only fresher smelling but also healthier. 

Designed and made in Britain.

Designed to last, the NONA Ocean Clothespin is manufactured in Britain to the highest ecological, ethical and manufacturing standards. 

Free worldwide delivery.

Our plastic free, letterbox friendly package ships worldwide to your door, for free.

Features. 

Made from 100% Recycled Ocean Plastic

  • Supports the circular economies that intercept plastic before it enters the ocean
  • Sourced as a result of a program in place across various ports that reimburses fisherman for worn-out fishing gear
  • Actively prevents wildlife destroying 'ghost nets' and wider ocean plastic pollution

Practically unbreakable

  • Mono-form design means that there are no moving parts to break
  • Will not rust, mould or degrade
  • Washable in warm soapy water

Effortless to use 

  • Swiftly glides on, smartly draws off, engineered to hold all types of laundry 
  • Unique wave design offers grip strengths ranging from delicate though to strong
  • Highly effective even in strong winds 

Additional benefits

  • Save as much as 1 ton of CO2 emissions every year by hang-drying clothes 
  • Gentler process than tumble drying, resulting in longer lasting clothes
  • Sunlight is known to kill viruses and bacteria, meaning line-dried clothes are both healthier and fresher smelling 

Quality & Ethical

  • Ocean plastic sourced is certified by vetted and trusted suppliers
  • Full supplier tracing of material source with measurable ecological impact
  • Made in Britain to the highest ecological, ethical and manufacturing standards

Shipping & Delivery

  • 100% plastic free, letterbox friendly package
  • Free delivery worldwide 

Project Timeline.

Research and development. 

3D modelling and rapid prototyping.

We have undertaken extensive design, 3D modelling, rapid prototyping and product testing. The product has been through a number of design, prototyping and evaluation cycles to optimise functionality. 

Manufacture and material procurement.

Our procurement process has ensured that all the material we use is verified by our suppliers for source authenticity, supply chain transparency and social, environmental and legal compliance. Our UK based manufacturers have been chosen for their experience, ecological and ethical standards. Our aim is to produce products with a long life that you will not need to buy again.

FAQs

Why Ocean Plastic?

The horrific amount of plastic that is entering our oceans has to stop. If oceanic ecosystems collapse and the oxygen producing phytoplankton that give us our every second breath die, it’s simple - no oceans no air (NONA).

Why the humble clothespin?

Because it’s a useful, everyday product! There are so many ecological issues that need addressing regarding clothing and laundry, from fast fashion to detergents and water consumption …and of course the CO2 emissions from unnecessary tumble drying. If we can remove plastic from the ocean, encourage line-drying (to reduce CO2), and highlight a very serious ecological issue then we’ve made a change, even if it is small - for now.

But shouldn’t we move completely away from plastic?

In an ideal world yes, however plastics have been a wonderful invention. They have allowed us to manufacture products and devices that would otherwise not be possible. From the delicate keypad I am typing on right now, through to medical devices that save lives - just try and imagine a world without any plastic!

Our issue to date has largely been a reluctance to design with end-of-life in mind or the implementation of full product lifecycle systems in order to retrieve and recycle plastics. NONA's aim right now is to find a use for recycled ocean plastic, and in this way we can support the emerging circular economies that are dedicated to intercepting plastic before it enters out oceans.

Why is the NONA Ocean Clothespin a better product?

Well apart from the ecological benefits of it being manufactured from recycled ocean plastic, the NONA Ocean Clothespin has been designed to last. The simple mono-form design means that there are no moving parts to break, no springs to malfunction, it won’t rust, mould, crack or degrade - it should last a very long time. It works by utilising the natural flexibility of the material, the design is functional simplicity. Moreover because it is manufactured out of a single material, it can, should it need to be, once again recycled.

NONA featured on the SHiFT Platform

NONA Ocean Clothespin has been featured on SHiFT.how as one of the ways to tackle ocean plastic pollution.

The SHiFT Method, created by Emily Penn, ocean advocate and eXXpedition Co-Founder, is designed to help people find their role in solving the world’s most pressing issues.

Emily’s philosophy towards life has been shaped by spending over a decade out at sea, where you are constantly reacting to the changes around you. 

For Emily, that shift led her from a career in architecture to one dedicated to solving the issue of ocean plastic pollution. The more time Emily spent at sea, the more she realised the solutions start on land. Through her workshops, curated experiences and sailing expeditions she’s worked with individuals, businesses and governments around the world to develop solutions, from sea to source.

Check out the new platform SHiFT.how and find other ways that can help you to reduce ocean plastic. #jointheSHiFT

Get social, follow us on.

 

Enquiries. 

For enquiries please contact us here madebynona.com

Resources and further reading. 

The circular economy solution to plastic pollution Ellen MacArthur Foundation

Women-led War on Plastic 1883 Magazine

By 2050, the oceans could have more plastic than fish Business Insider

How does plastic end up in the ocean? WWF

PLANET OR PLASTIC? Baby fish have started eating plastic. We haven’t yet seen the consequences National Geographic

Sunlight destroys virus quickly Yahoo! News

5 Reasons to Ditch your Dryer Green America

Risks and challenges

Production

We have already completed extensive research and development using 3D modelling and rapid prototyped components. As soon as we are funded we will start production with our UK based manufacturer.

We have planned out the critical path and are able to scale production if we exceed our goal. We are very confident in our timeline, however we will never settle for a product that falls below the high standards that we have set, we will never compromise on quality or cut corners,

If we encounter any unexpected circumstances we promise to keep you updated about how and when we will deliver to you the quality product that you would expect.

Ocean Plastic Promise

The material we have procured is verified by our suppliers for source authenticity, supply chain transparency; and social, environment and legal compliance. We will never compromise on this.

Covid-19

Health and safety across the supply chain is a top priority, we will always ensure to follow all government guidelines and we expect the same from our partners too.

We are in regular contact with our material suppliers and manufacturers regarding potential implications of Covid-19, we remain 100% confident about achieving our manufacturing timeline.

Environmental commitments

Long-lasting design

The NONA Ocean Clothespin is a simple yet effective design, it's inherent toughness, natural flexibility and UV resistance means it is practically unbreakable.

Reusability and recyclability

The NONA Ocean Clothespin has been designed and manufactured to have a very long life, the aim is for it to stay out of oceans and landfill. Moreover because it is manufactured out of a single material, it can, should it need to be, once again recycled. Moreover our recyclable, letterbox friendly delivery package is 100% plastic free.

Sustainable materials

The use of ecologically considerate materials is central to NONA's mission, by specifying ocean plastic we are able to support the circular economies that intercept plastic waste before it enters our oceans.

Environmentally friendly factories

We have chosen a UK based manufacturer, to achieve a superior quality product and to ensure the highest ethical, worker and environmental standards. Moreover local production reduces the carbon footprint from travel and shipping.

Sustainable Distribution

Our compact letterbox friendly delivery package ensures that distribution can be fulfilled by traditional global postal services ...and we deliver worldwide, for free.

Small choices that define you.The choices you make every day, no matter how small, become the foundation of your world.And today is no different.Today, you have the choice to be a changemaker. A real changemaker.Today, you can choose to reduce carbon emissions and help stabilize our atmospheric systems.You can choose to support the interception of plastics from our oceans to ensure the foundation of our food chain is balanced and functional.You can choose to help our oceans so they can keep supporting oxygen production for healthy air.You can make one small choice and catalyze monumental change.The kind of change that even a clothespin can make..The NONA Recycled Ocean Plastic Clothespin is no ordinary clothespin.Your little clothespin is an investment in cleaning up plastic pollution in our oceans. It is a symbol of your active fight against climate change. story:
Help New Vision send solar lights to survivors of Typhoon Haiyan!

Super Typhoon Haiyan barreled into the Philippines with winds as high as 190 mph.  According to the latest statistics, nearly 5,200 deaths and some 4.3 million people -- one million of whom were children -- have been displaced by one of the worst disasters in history.  

Although clean water, food, and medical care have reached most of the survivors -- they are still without light. The darkness poses challenges for relief workers and survivors alike.

New Vision Renewable Energy has a goal to provide 1,000 solar lights to the Philippines by January 1st, 2014.

The New Vision Portable Solar Power Pack & Light system will bring a light of hope to the survivors of the typhoon. The solar powered LED light is strong enough to provide whole room lighting and charge much needed cell phones.

New Vision is working with several nonprofits, including Dr. Juval Galera, Pastor of Eastside Baptist Church in the city of Carcar, to reach a network of over 200 ministers and churches. They are ready to distribute safe and clean portable solar lights to communities in need. Dr. Juval is also supported by Feed the Children and Expecting An Encounter ministries.

But we need your help to bring light and hope back to the Philippines.

With your donation, New Vision will provide much-needed support that is not only essential now but will help light the way for families and communities even after order has been restored.

Please help us reach our goal of 1,000 lights and put light in the hands of the people who need them most -- especially the most vulnerable --  women, children and the elderly who need light during the darkest hour of their lives.

Light can make the difference between living and surviving for millions of people in the Philippines today and tomorrow. Each light costs $100 plus shipping and we are working with our NGO partners to ensure safe passage into the hands of those living in darkness. If you would like to help connect us to other partners on the ground, please email info@nvre.org.


New Vision is a registered 501(c)3 nonprofit and all donations are tax deductible less the actual amount of the perk. As a member of the U.N. Energy Access Practitioner Network, we strategically partner with individuals, businesses, nonprofits and corporations to help bring an end to energy poverty.
